clinical_study.brief_title: Time Outdoors as an Intervention for Myopia in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Time Outdoors as an Intervention for Myopia in Children——School-based Randomized Controlled Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether improved outdoor time has an effect on the onset and progression of myopia in children.

primary_outcome.description: The Cycloplegic refraction of all children are measured by auto-refractor(KR-8900, Topcon)

secondary_outcome.description: The axial length of the eyeball are measured by IOL Master(version 5.02, Carl Zeiss).

intervention.description: Dose 1 plus an additional 40-minute outdoor activities during recesses

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center
